data.text: Fully Loaded Touring Bike on a Train in Spain?

data.text: I did travel in Spain with my loaded bike in August. It was more difficult than I anticipated. I knew Iâ€™d have to take the MD train as it takes bikes. But there were only 3 spots per train and you have to reserve them well in advance. In order to reserve I had to go to the train station in Valencia. I managed to get to my destination. But on the way back there were no more spots available. I had to call in order to make a reservation but itâ€™s in Spanish. Not easy. Ok MD spots were full, but I was sure I could still take the local train (vicinity Valencia) in order to be back in time to take the plane home. Because I didnâ€™t trust it I asked the tourist office to call to reassure me. But big problem I couldnâ€™t take the local train with the bike because itâ€™s a special festivity time (which was changed because of covid) and trains donâ€™t take bikes during these days. Fortunately I could take a bus with my bike in the bag storage without hassle. I could have ridden the 70km in one day but the weather became torrential. So as long as it works itâ€™s ok but donâ€™t expect the same bike service as in Netherlands. Fortunately Spanish people are very friendly and will help you.
